thinking.disposable_income: West Elsdon is a working-class community with median household income around $53,000, lower than Chicago's average. Many residents work in service and industrial sectors, making them sensitive to transportation costs and taxes
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Limited discretionary spending capacity due to moderate income levels. Higher sales taxes would significantly impact household budgets. Many families need to carefully balance transportation costs with other essential expenses
thinking.accessibility: Located on southwest side with moderate transit access via Orange Line and buses. High car dependency with 85% of households owning vehicles. Many residents commute by car to jobs throughout the metro area. Transit times significantly longer than driving times
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize lower sales tax (0.5%) due to limited discretionary income. 2. Balance moderate transit fares ($1.25) to maintain service while keeping costs affordable. 3. Support modest driving fees ($0.50) to improve transit without overly burdening car-dependent residents. 4. Focus on proposals that reduce transit travel times to under 55 minutes. 5. Consider proposals that maintain reasonable driving costs given high car ownership rates
